result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Louis M Genske was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan

miscConds.notes: Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.
Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall attend the Victim Offender Impact Panel on 9/24/15 at 7:00 p.m.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant granted good time credit.
6 months stayed - to be used at Agent's discretion.
Defendant may serve in any jail arrangements can be made.
